layer.name: Skill
layer.definition: Get measurably better at what matters.

questions.text: My effectiveness as a learner is ...
questions.principle: Learning how to learn is foundational skill

answers.4: good — I know how I learn best and use that knowledge
answers.5: optimized — I have refined methods that make learning efficient
answers.2: basic — I can learn but slowly and inefficiently
answers.3: developing — some approaches work, I'm still figuring it out
answers.1: poor — I struggle to learn new things

questions.text: My ability to synthesize information from multiple sources is ...

answers.4: good — I can build coherent understanding from diverse inputs
answers.5: strong — I naturally integrate information into bigger pictures
answers.2: basic — I can combine simple ideas but struggle with complexity
answers.3: developing — I synthesize some things well, fragment others
answers.1: poor — I collect facts but can't integrate them

answers.4: good — I can evaluate arguments and spot fallacies reliably
answers.5: sharp — I think clearly under pressure and see what others miss
answers.2: basic — I can spot obvious errors but miss subtle ones
answers.3: developing — I think critically sometimes, accept uncritically others
answers.1: poor — I accept what I hear without evaluation

questions.text: My ability to explain complex ideas simply is ...

answers.4: good — I can translate complexity for others
answers.5: strong — I can make almost anything understandable
answers.2: basic — I can explain simple things simply
answers.3: developing — I explain some things well, muddle others
answers.1: poor — I struggle to explain even what I understand

questions.text: My intentional work to improve my thinking is ...

answers.4: regular — I treat my mind as a tool to be sharpened
answers.5: systematic — I have ongoing practices that continuously improve my thinking
answers.2: occasional — I sometimes try to think better
answers.3: inconsistent — I work on it sometimes, neglect it others
answers.1: absent — I just use my mind as-is

remediation.advice: Thinking is a skill. Reading is a skill. Learning is a skill. Study how to learn (spaced repetition, active recall, elaboration). Practice critical thinking deliberately. Write to clarify your thoughts. The mind is trainable — but you have to actually train it.

scripture.text: Wisdom is the principal thing; therefore get wisdom: and with all your getting get understanding.
